details.description: Search for a personalised number plate registration and buy it from DVLA online or at auction
details.more_information:
Personalised registration numbers can only be used on a vehicle registered (or about to be registered), taxed and used in Great Britain.

You can’t make the vehicle look newer than it actually is. For example, you can’t put an ‘07’ registration number onto a 2003 registered vehicle.

When you buy a personalised registration number, you’re buying the right to assign this number to a vehicle registered in your name or someone else’s name (the nominee).
details.introduction: You can buy a personalised registration for your number plates from DVLA online or at auction. Search online to see which numbers are available and how much they cost.
details.alternate_methods:
##Registration number auctions

[DVLA Personalised Registrations](http://dvlaregistrations.direct.gov.uk/auction/ "DVLA Personalised Registrations"){:rel="external"} also auctions some exclusive registration numbers. Auctions are held about 6 times a year and reserve prices start from £130. You can bid online, in person, by phone or in writing.

##Private sales

You can also buy a personalised registration number from a dealer or from a motorist in a private sale. If you do this, make sure you receive the V750 certificate of entitlement or V778 certificate of retention.

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency

details.description: Includes selling your vehicle, personalised registration numbers and registering your vehicle

Book your driving test or get a tax disc online, find out the legal requirements for buying, owning, importing or scrapping a car or motorcycle, and read about your rights and responsibilities as a driver.
Buying personalised registrations, getting them assigned to a vehicle, renewing or updating the V750 entitlement certificate and getting plates made up
